Using Audit Log Filters

Filtering allows you to limit the types and numbers of entries that appear in the Audit list on the upper pane. The application includes default filters, but if desired you can customize filters and create new ones. See Creating a Filter.

To control the data shown on the upper pane, select a filter from the Filter drop-down list box on the toolbar.

The information displayed in the Audit list also depends upon:

  • The folder you have selected from the left pane

  • The selection of the All Descendants button from the toolbar.

The default audit filters include:

<Show All>

Displays all entries (default).

By Class and Event

Displays audit entries sorted by their value in the Class Name 1 field (type of item) and Event (type of action) field.

You may also want to create the following filters:

  • Event, to display only the entries that were modified.

  • Class Name, to display only actions performed on a specific type of item (for example, change requests).

  • Created Time, to display only entries created from the specified date to the present.

  • User, to display only the entries about actions performed by a specific user.
